mainPage.main: A new way to manage your Battlefield 1 servers
mainPage.description: Server Manager is a new Gametools & BFBan service created by Community Network

0.heading: BFBan Anti Cheat
0.body: Protect your servers against hackers confirmed on www.bfban.com

1.heading: Unlimited Global V-Ban list
1.body: Ban as many players as you want to on all your servers with virtual ban list.

2.heading: High ping players kick
2.body: Automatically kick players from your servers based on ping threshold.

3.heading: Discord tools to maintain server
3.body: Contol your servers right in the Discord based on roles.

4.heading: Server action logging
4.body: See full logs on every actions made on your servers and groups.

5.heading: Full control over your servers
5.body: Admins can control servers with same functions as in game.

statistics.main: Used by {{communities}} Communities with a total of {{servers}} servers

weekly.globalbanKicks: players kicked via Global V-Ban lists

createGroup.description: Create a new group to manage your community servers
createGroup.discordDescription: Optionaly, you can add your discord server, to integrate server tools
createGroup.cookieDescription0: Every group need to be assigned special account with certain requirments:
createGroup.cookieDescription1: It should be a BF1 server moderator (owner access not required)
createGroup.cookieDescription2: If this account is used for BF1, it shouldn't be used anywhere else. otherwise it will lead in errors
createGroup.acceptDescription0: By pressing this button, you agree to give
createGroup.acceptDescription1: server manager tool access to the account.

admins.description1: You need to have at least Owner role to add new admins.

seeding.description1: You need at least Owner role to access this panel,
seeding.description2: You have to run the application from the link below this message on every pc that you want to have help with seeding

exclusions.description0: List of players excluded from autokick (ping and bfban).

discord.commandList: for a list of commands that you can use in Discord, use the "!bfadmin" command.
discord.permDescription0: Every person with that role id can use
discord.permDescription1: discord commands to control the server.

settings.visableBansDesc: Allow your servers bans to be visable when someone checks if a player is banned somewhere else already:

ingameSettings.cookie: Cookie used to make the server changes, both cookies set in manager and sid/remid are possible:

banList.description0: List of banned players on this server.
banList.description3: Use our group-based virtual ban list,
banList.description4: to ban unlimited amount of players.

vipList.description0: List of VIP players on this server.

adminList.description0: List of admins on this server.

firestarterList.description0: We measure when your server's preround ended and count all the players that are in the server when it starts,
firestarterList.description1: so you can check here who is helping you start your server.

playTimeList.description0: List of how long each player has been on this server, so you could give something special to the player as thanks for playing.
playTimeList.description1: This data is per week and measured as "hours:minutes"

table.playCount: Amount of times joined in this week

spectatorList.description0: We keep a list of who spectated the server within the last 24 hours,
spectatorList.description1: because there exists a hack within Battlefield 1 that allows them to control players in the game itself...
spectatorList.description2: This is one way to fight back against those hackers.

playerLogs.description0: We keep a list of who is in the server within the last 24 hours,
playerLogs.description1: because a group of hackers keeps crashing the servers.
playerLogs.description2: This is one way to find out when/who did it.
playerLogs.description3: Filter the list to only show when a specific player is in the returned list:

protection.title: Auto server protection
protection.vBanDescription0: Introducing new tools developed to protect your servers against hackers.
protection.vBanDescription1: Global Virtual Ban list auto-kicks players on
protection.vBanDescription4: infinity amount of ban slots and synchronized ban list.
protection.vbanReasonDesc0: This msg appear to users who got
protection.bfbanDescription: Protect server against known cheaters in
protection.pingKickDescription: Auto kick players with constant high ping
protection.pingKickMinDesc: Mimimum amount of players for autokick to start working (0 for always)
protection.KickRankDesc: Kick a player based on their rank ingame
protection.kickLowRank: Kick if rank is lower than:
protection.kickHighRank: Kick if rank is higher than:
protection.statsKick: Kick if weapon/vehicle stats are too high (autokick starts after 200 or more kills with the specified weapon)
protection.pltMemberExclDescription: Exclude the platoonmembers from the platoons you add in the panel from being kicked.

settings.title: Server settings
settings.name: Server Name
settings.aliasDescription: Alias to use with a Discord bot. (Can be a server number, for example)
settings.cookie: Set the account used to get info and do changes to the server

discordBot.tokenDesc: The Discord token it will use for the server status bot (a worker will automaticly be created after you fill in the discord token and press apply)
discordBot.channelDesc: The Discord channel id it will post the changes in playeramount to
discordBot.minPlayerAmount: min. amount to start a round
discordBot.minPlayerAmountDesc: Minimum amount of players to start a round in the server's current gamemode
discordBot.prevReqCountDesc: How many request it needs to check between started and running, (default = 5, 5 * 2 == 10 minutes)
discordBot.startedAmountDesc: How many players count as a running server
discordBot.ownerIdDesc: In Battlefield 5 and Battlefield 2042 servers are free, because of that its really easy to copy someones server. fill the playerid of the serverowner in here to prevent that.
discordBot.restartWorkerDesc: Restart the serverstatus bot (does the same when you apply a change)

cookieInfo.link: Click here for info on how to get the sid and remid
cookieInfo.main: How to get the SID and REMID cookies
cookieInfo.1: in incognito mode with Chrome or Edge.
cookieInfo.2: 2. Login with the account you want to use, don't forget to check "Remember me".
cookieInfo.3: 3. After login, click on the lock:
cookieInfo.5: 5. Expand "accounts.ea.com" and click on sid and/or remid to view the cookie under "Content"
cookieInfo.6: 6. After you got the SID and REMID cookie dont logout, just close the browser.
cookieInfo.7: If you logout the cookies are no longer valid.

statusBotInfo.link: Click here for info on how to get discord token and invite the bot to your discord
statusBotInfo.1: 1. Login to the Discord developer portal:
statusBotInfo.2: 2. Click on "New Application" on the top right, give the bot a name and press create.
statusBotInfo.3: 3. Click on "Bot" on the right and press "Add Bot".
statusBotInfo.4: 4. Copy the Discord token from there and paste it in the "Discord token" field within "Server settings" of the manager and press "Apply" on the bottom.
statusBotInfo.5: Add the bot to your discord:
statusBotInfo.6: 5. On the newly created bot, on the "General Information" page, click on "Copy" under "Application ID"
statusBotInfo.7: 6. Copy this link: https://discord.com/oauth2/authorize?client_id=APPLICATION_ID&scope=bot, replace "APPLICATION_ID" with the Application Id got from step 5 and open the link in your browser.
statusBotInfo.8: 7. Select the server you want to invite the bot to and press Authorize.
statusBotInfo.9: The bot doesnt need any special permissions to show status of the server, to send messages it needs the permission to send messages, embeds and images.

ApiInfo.link: Click here to get all the available requests for the API
